activities:
The Brivo® Online Access Control™ System (ACS) enables businesses to control physical access to offices, warehouses, remote/unmanned buildings, or sensitive areas such as computer rooms, where real-time control and accountability of entry are important. The company's Web-hosted solutions are based on proprietary technology that connects dispersed facilities to the Internet using secure, wide-area communications.

Brivo does not sell or distribute "any" information residing on our servers. The only time customer data is reviewed is when the customer calls Brivo's Customer Care for assistance. The customer must request and approve access to their account, customer verification of "security" phrase before a Brivo technican may proceed with such request.   The technician is tracked during the access of the data to ensure they are complying with our SSAE 16 SOC 1 Type 2 procedures.
recoursemech: The Brivo privacy email address is set in the privacy policy for the express purpose of handling Safe Harbor issues. Disputes will be handled within Brivo by privacy officers, in house counsel and in cooperation with appropriate regulatory bodies.
